newsitem.title: USA: Innotech in pact to buy optics company.
newsitem.headline: Innotech in pact to buy optics company.

text.p: Innotech Inc said on Wednesday it signed a pact to buy an optics company that is developing a technology aimed at partially restoring sight in patients with central field vision loss.
Central field vision loss is a leading cause of blindness affecting more than two million people in the United States alone, the company said.

Innotech said it entered into a letter of intent with privately held Prism Ophthalmics L.L.C.. The deal provides for the purchase of both an option to buy all of Prism for $5 million and a warrant to buy 15 percent of Prism.
Under the letter of intent, Innotech would pay both $400,000 to buy the option and $1.2 million to purchase the warrant.
The purchase of the option and warrant is subject to the execution and delivery of definitive agreements, Innotech said.

Innotech's $1.6 million purchase price for the option and warrant would be used by Prism for further development, clinical evaluation and commercialization of a prismatic implant product, the company said.
